revised_title: Investigating the Presence of Specific Bacteria in Ventilating Pipes, Drains, and Sewers
tldr: The author conducted experiments to determine the conditions under which specific bacteria from sewage can be present in the air of ventilating pipes, drains, inspection chambers, and sewers. The experiments showed that bacteria can be carried by air currents and ejected from flowing sewage, even without the presence of bubbles. This study is important for understanding the spread of bacteria in public health and sanitation systems.
